titles.title: FOR VETS Act of 2010
Formerly Owned Resources for Veterans to Express Thanks for Service Act of 2010
FOR VETS Act of 2010
Formerly Owned Resources for Veterans to Express Thanks for Service Act of 2010
FOR VETS Act of 2010
Formerly Owned Resources for Veterans to Express Thanks for Service Act of 2010
FOR VETS Act of 2010
Formerly Owned Resources for Veterans to Express Thanks for Service Act of 2010

A bill to amend chapter 5 of title 40, United States Code, to include organizations whose membership comprises substantially veterans as recipient organizations for the donation of Federal surplus personal property through State agencies.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

calendar.text: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs. Ordered to be reported with an amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs. Reported by Senator Lieberman with an amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 628.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent.

reference.label: text of measure as reported in Senate

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.
Ms. Chu moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 3794.
DEBATE - The House resumed debate on S. 3794.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.name: Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

bill.summary: 12/22/2010--Public Law. Formerly Owned Resources for Veterans to Express Thanks for Service Act of 2010 or FOR VETS Act of 2010 - Authorizes the transfer of federal surplus property to a state agency for distribution through donation within the state for purposes of education or public health for organizations whose membership comprises substantially veterans and whose representatives are recognized by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs (VA) in the preparation, presentation, and prosecution of claims under laws administered by the Secretary.
